intro: Ranunculus trisepalus, commonly known as the three-sepal buttercup, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers with five sepals. Native to southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in moist, temperate climates. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardens and botanical studies.
